p: Lycoris radiata (L’Hér.) Herb. ( Amaryllidaceae) originally grew in China, Korea and Nepal and was later distributed to other countries, including Russia. It is a source of pharmacologically active alkaloids, with lycorine being the main one [ 11, 23, 24, 25, 26]. Lycorine has selective antiviral activity, including against severe acute respiratory syndrome associated with coronavirus and influenza virus [ 11, 21, 27].
